rows.INSTRUCTIONS SPEC — SELF-EXPLANATORY TAB: Every tab must answer every question. Nobody should ever need to ask Nilo anything.
THE THICK BOUNDARY
The boundary between Nilo and everyone else is: THE TABS SPEAK FOR THEMSELVES.
If someone reads their tabs and still has a question, that's a failure of the Trade.
It means the tab is incomplete. The fix is not 'ask Nilo.' The fix is: Claude fills the gap,
librarian updates the tab, and the question never gets asked again.
The MC is the pressure valve for human questions. But even the MC should be able to
answer most questions by pointing to tabs. 'Oh, that's in your P-tab, section 3.'
Nilo touches the Trade in exactly two places:
1. Week 0: Produce M0 and S0 with Claude (the seed)
2. Week 8+: Final V-tab sign-offs (the grade)
Everything in between: librarian distributes, people work, MC records, Claude fills gaps.
INSTRUCTIONS.md TEMPLATE (every working folder gets one)
Every working folder the librarian creates contains an INSTRUCTIONS.md file.
This file is role-specific. It tells the person everything they need to know.
─── TEMPLATE ───
# Welcome to the IonWave Trade
## Who You Are
[Role name]. [One sentence about what this role does.]
## Your Scope
You own: [list of specific models/tabs]
You can read: Everything in the MASTER folder (read-only link below)
You edit: Only the files in THIS folder
## What 'Done' Looks Like
[Specific, measurable criteria for each tab they own]
- P-tab: Fill in every section. No blanks. If uncertain, write your best guess and flag it.
- Content tabs: Complete every field. Cite sources where possible.
- V-tab: You don't fill this in. The expert does.
## How To Work
1. Read the MASTER folder for context (start with M0 Thesis, then your cluster's IP-tabs)
2. Read each P-tab in your working folder (these are your project plans)
3. Produce the content tabs (use Claude if you have access, or work from the P-tab spec)
4. When a tab is complete, move it to your SUBMIT/ folder
5. The librarian will update the master and schedule your expert review
## When You Have Questions
1. Check your P-tab first (most answers are there)
2. Check the MASTER folder (search for keywords)
3. Ask the MC (they'll record the conversation — your question becomes content)
4. If none of the above: flag it in your SUBMIT/ folder as 'QUESTION: [your question]'
The librarian will route it to Claude, get an answer, and update the tab.
## You Do NOT Need To
- Talk to Nilo (he'll see your work at V-tab sign-off)
- Coordinate with other clusters (the librarian handles cross-cluster dependencies)
- Worry about the site, the fundraise, or anything outside your scope
- Attend meetings (MC conversations are the only scheduled touchpoint)
## Your MC Conversations
The MC will schedule [X] conversations with you:
- Onboarding conversation (Day 1): Who are you, what excites you, what's your background?
- Working conversations (weekly): What are you finding? What's surprising? What's hard?
- Completion conversation (final): What did you build? What would you change? What grade?
All conversations are recorded and published. This is part of the series. Be yourself. Have fun.
## Links
- MASTER folder (read-only): [link]
- Your WORKING folder (edit): [link]
- MC scheduling: [link or email]
- Librarian contact: [email]
─── END TEMPLATE ───
WHAT EACH TAB TYPE NEEDS (self-explanatory checklist)
Tab Type
rows.col_3: Reader Can Answer Without Asking Anyone

rows.INSTRUCTIONS SPEC — SELF-EXPLANATORY TAB: P- (Project Plan)
rows.col_2: Scope statement. Deliverables list. "Done" criteria per deliverable. Timeline. Dependencies on other models. Key decisions already made. Key decisions still open.
rows.col_3:
"What am I supposed to produce?" → YES
"How will I know it's done?" → YES
"What do I need from other models?" → YES
"When is it due?" → YES

rows.INSTRUCTIONS SPEC — SELF-EXPLANATORY TAB: C- (Contract)
rows.col_2: Role title. Equity amount. Time commitment. Duration. Deliverables. IP assignment. Termination. Comp details.
rows.col_3:
"What do I get paid?" → YES
"How much equity?" → YES
"What happens if I leave?" → YES
"Who owns my work?" → YES

rows.INSTRUCTIONS SPEC — SELF-EXPLANATORY TAB: IP- (Industry)
rows.col_2: Domain context. Key terms defined. Current best practices. Common pitfalls. Reference examples. Benchmarks. What experts in this field care about.
rows.col_3:
"What is this domain about?" → YES
"What does good look like?" → YES
"What are the common mistakes?" → YES
"What would an expert check for?" → YES

rows.INSTRUCTIONS SPEC — SELF-EXPLANATORY TAB: V- (Verification)
rows.col_2: Grading rubric (A/B/C/D/F). What each grade means for this specific model. Sign-off fields. Expert name. Date. Comments per section.
rows.col_3:
"How do I grade this?" → YES
"What's the difference between A and B?" → YES
"Where do I write my feedback?" → YES

rows.INSTRUCTIONS SPEC — SELF-EXPLANATORY TAB: Content tabs
rows.col_2: Header with model name and purpose. Instructions at top: "This tab covers X. Fill in every field. If uncertain, flag with [?] and the expert will address it." Field labels that are self-explanatory. Examples where helpful.
rows.col_3:
"What goes in this field?" → YES
"How detailed should I be?" → YES
"What format?" → YES
